title: Senior Field Engineer
description:
We are seeking an experienced Senior Field Engineer to join our team in Houston. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in oilfield operations, equipment maintenance, and client relations.

Responsibilities:
- Lead field operations and provide technical expertise
- Troubleshoot equipment issues and implement solutions
- Train junior engineers and field technicians
- Ensure safety protocols are followed at all times
- Maintain detailed documentation of operations

Qualifications:
- 5+ years of field engineering experience
- Strong mechanical and electrical troubleshooting skills
- Excellent communication and leadership abilities
- Willingness to travel to remote locations

title: Drilling Specialist
description:
Join our drilling operations team as a Drilling Specialist. This role involves on-site management of drilling equipment and coordination with field crews.

Key Responsibilities:
- Monitor drilling operations and equipment performance
- Implement drilling programs and procedures
- Coordinate with geologists and operations teams
- Ensure compliance with HSE standards

title: Offshore Driller
description:
Noble Corporation is hiring experienced Offshore Drillers for our Gulf of Mexico operations. This is a rotational position (28 days on / 28 days off).

Requirements:
- Valid IADC Driller certification
- Minimum 3 years offshore drilling experience
- Strong knowledge of rig operations and safety procedures
- Ability to work in a team environment under challenging conditions

We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for career advancement.

title: Maintenance Supervisor
description:
Lead our offshore maintenance team to ensure optimal rig performance and safety. This supervisory role requires strong technical skills and leadership experience.

Duties:
- Supervise maintenance crew of 8-12 technicians
- Plan and coordinate preventive maintenance programs
- Troubleshoot complex mechanical and electrical issues
- Ensure compliance with all maintenance procedures and safety standards

title: Project Engineer - LNG Facilities
description:
KBR is seeking a Project Engineer to support our LNG facility projects. The successful candidate will work on engineering design, project execution, and client coordination.

Responsibilities:
- Support engineering design and analysis for LNG facilities
- Coordinate with multidisciplinary engineering teams
- Review technical documentation and drawings
- Assist in project planning and scheduling
- Interface with clients and vendors

Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in Chemical, Mechanical, or Process Engineering
- 3-5 years of experience in oil & gas or LNG projects
- Proficiency in engineering software and design tools
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

title: Construction Manager
description:
Manage construction activities for major industrial projects. This role requires extensive construction management experience and strong leadership capabilities.

Key Responsibilities:
- Oversee all construction activities on site
- Manage construction contractors and subcontractors
- Ensure quality, safety, and schedule compliance
- Coordinate with engineering, procurement, and project teams
- Prepare progress reports and manage budget

title: Instrumentation Technician
description:
Seeking skilled Instrumentation Technician to maintain and calibrate field instrumentation and control systems.

Requirements:
- 2+ years instrumentation experience
- Knowledge of PLCs, control systems, and field devices
- Strong troubleshooting skills
- Valid driver's license
